questions.question: You are flying a VFR route and have become uncertain of your position. Which is the best course of action?
options: set heading towards a line feature - coastline, river or motorway
turn round and fly your flight plan tracks in reverse until you see something you recognised before
fly a series of ever-expanding circles from your present position till you find your next checkpoint
turn round and fly your flight plan in reverse back to base
questions.solution: set heading towards a line feature - coastline, river or motorway

questions.question: Please refer to Appendix A (Page 233). What is the symbol for an unlighted obstacle?
Using the Jeppesen E(LO)1, position 5211N 00931W, which of the following denotes all the symbols?
Using the Jeppesen E(LO)1 chart, what are the symbols at Galway Carnmore (5318.1N 00856.5W)?
options: civil airport, NDB, DME, non-compulsory reporting point
VOR, NDB, DME, compulsory reporting point
civil airport, VOR, DME, non-compulsory reporting point
VOR, NDB, DME, non-compulsory reporting point
questions.solution: VOR, NDB, DME, compulsory reporting point

questions.question: Which of the following is the symbol for an exceptionally high (over 1000 feet AGL) lighted obstruction?
What symbol is used to show a VORTAC on a map/chart?
Which is the symbol for a VOR?
An aircraft flying VFR using visual navigation crosses two parallel roads at right angles to the track. For what purpose could that information be used?
Which of the following would be most useful as a visual checkpoint when planning a flight?
